crew/player-characters/holly-jones.html.title: Holly Jones
crew/player-characters/holly-jones.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Nightingale NumRank:: 3 Rank:: Lt. Commander Type:: Player Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Human Role:: Intelligence Agent
Portrait:: Note:: Assigned to the Nightingale by Starfleet Intelligence to provide intel on the Expanse back to command. Holly grew up in San Francisco, where her Mother was an Admiral. Her father was away for work most of her life, and she didn’t really know why. After she graduated from Admiral Kathryn Janeway Highschool, she joined Starfleet Academy on a Security track. During her time in the academy, she received word that her father had been killed, and she thought about quitting, but decided to continue on in his memory. After she graduated, she was assigned to the USS Firebrand, a Freedom Class ship as a Security officer. During her time on the Firebrand, she developed the skills required to be a Combat Medic by working closely with the ships doctor.About a year after joining her crew, they were patrolling near Wolf-359, when they received a hail from the USS Melbourne that the Borg had been sighted. Rushing to her aid, they watched in horror as the Borg destroyed the Melbourne. During the Battle, the Firebrand was critically damaged, and the Captain ordered the full evacuation of the crew. On her way to the escape pods, she watched a bulkhead blow infront of her, and suck out everyone into space before a force field sprang up, saving her life. Only her and the XO, Cmdr T’prel, survived. They spent 3 days floating in the debris field of the battle, not knowing if, or when, they would be rescued.After being rescued, the two were returned to Earth for debriefing, and Holly wanted to resign her commission, but Commander T’prel convinced her that that would be an insult to the memory of the crew they lost. She was promoted to a Full Lieutenant, and assigned to the USS Fresno, a California Class ship, and placed in charge of the security department. She spent the next 4 years of her life on the Fresno, before she requested some shore leave for the Anniversary of Wolf 359.Holly traveled back to Earth to meet up with Commander T’prel, who had recently been promoted to Captain. Captain T’prel informed her that she was now working with Starfleet Inelegance, and that she wanted Holly to join her, so they could work to stop another event like Wolf 359 before it even happened. What was supposed to be a quick weekend trip to remember fallen friends and crew, turned into a shift in her career. Now officially working for Intelligence, she was sent on an assignment to gather information about a new cell of the Maquis operating out of The Badlands. While investigating, she stumbled upon a small craft trying to smuggle goods off of Bajor, and was able to apprehend the pilot. Turning him over to Starfleet, she was able to ascertain where the goods were being smuggled to, and transferred the intelligence to T’prel.She then spent the next 7 years continuing to work for T’prel, becoming a prime asset for Starfleet Intelligence, building up her own network of informants. During this time, she learned from on of her informants that her Father was killed while on assignment for Starfleet Intelligence. Reeling from this information, she called her mother to subtly ask what her father did for work. Her mother replied that her father worked for Starfleet, but due to the nature of his job, was unable to verify exactly what he did. While she was doing assignments, she kept investigating her father on the side, and eventually discovered that he worked for Section 31, the secretive arm of Starfleet intelligence.One day, T’prel called her into Starfleet HQ to let her know she was going to be transferred to a starship to keep tabs on events unfolding in the Shackleton Expanse, and to listen to the orders of those above her on the ship, but remember where her loyalties lie. Holly was then promoted to Lt Commander, and given orders to travel with all due speed to Narendra Station, and board the USS Nightingale, under the command of Captain Robin Zhao.Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/player-characters/siltec-nol.html.title: Siltec Nol
crew/player-characters/siltec-nol.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: he/him Player:: Aram Vartian
Location:: USS Nightingale Type:: Main Character Status:: Enlisted NumRank:: 12 Rank:: Petty Officer Species:: Cardassian Role:: Security Specialist
Portrait:: Note:: Formerly recruited by Starfleet Intelligence. Now just looking to do some good in the world.
Siltec was born on Earth after his mother, a Legate in the Obsidian Order, showed up at Jupiter Station with 1000 strips of gold pressed latinum and a stolen Cardassian shuttle. She exchanged information for certain assurances, including the protection of her unborn son. Starfleet agreed and set them up in a safehouse: Zefram Cochrane's old Montana ranch, which had since been converted into a cultural center and basic survival training post for Starfleet cadets. Siltec grew up with a love for horses and big open night skies. He would lay on the roof at night and count the stars he would visit when he got to join Starfleet. His mother did not approve, and used her influence to ensure his bid for the academy would not be accepted. But she could stop him from enlisting. She could, however, influence where his first assignment was. Siltec's heart dropped when he opened his duty papers and saw that he was headed right back to the ranch where he grew up, under the watchful eye of his mother.
He spent a few years running young Starfleet officers through survival training bootcamp, then watched them leave to follow his dream among the stars. When Starfleet Intelligence dropped by to offer him a deal, he leapt at the chance. Starfleet gets two things from this deal: Siltec is a good agent. Once his mom got him back in the nest, she wasn't nearly as forthcoming with information, so Starfleet sees this as a way to use her son's safety (and constant updates on his whereabouts and actions) as a negotiating tool.
Siltec only had one request: a billet aboard the USS Nightingale and a path to adventure.Value1:: Trust, but verify Value2:: The front line is a privilege Value3:: I am willing to sacrifice myself for my crewmates Value4:: Fear no evil
Both Yalis and Siltec have a deep love of husbandry and horses.
Siltec and Valera have a friendship forged by their shared experience of being seen as Starfleet's "bad guys"
Siltec reports directly to Chief Petty Officer Artax,
Vrenta Ewasi is a Bajoran, and has a deep rooted suspicion of Siltec. This may even be well founded considering Siltec's family connection to the Obsidian Order and his relationship with Starfleet Intelligence.
Misham Nol is Siltec's mom. She is a former member of the Obsidian Order turned refugee. She raised Siltec on Earth. When Siltec tried to join Starfleet Academy, Misham pulled the right strings to prevent his acceptance. Then, when Siltec enlisted anyways, MIsham dug up dirt on his captain.

crew/player-characters/valera.html.title: Valera
crew/player-characters/valera.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: she/her Location:: Unknown Type:: Non-Player Character Status:: Commissioned NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Species:: Orion Role:: Flight Controller Portrait:: Note:: Speed demon most at home among the stars.
Valera was born on the Orion starship Utuharga, and didn’t set foot on an actual planet for the first 10 years of her life. Her formative years were shaped by the independence and adaptability that life in space required, honing her instincts and skills long before formal training. She finds the gravity on most M class planets to be…weird, and has trouble sleeping without the hum of a starship.
At 16, during a trade negotiation mission with her family on Starbase 12, Valera seized a Federation shuttlecraft for a joyride; pushing the shuttle’s limits to evade capture, till she decided she was done and returned the shuttle. Her stunt captured the attention of Captain Liu. Rather than meting out discipline, Liu recognized her aptitude and saw untapped potential in her. Convincing her that she could fly “further and faster” than ever before, the Liu sponsored her entry into Starfleet Academy, where Valera quickly rose to the top of her class in flight training.
When Liu (now Commander) was given a posting on the newly christened USS Nightingale, Valera (along with fellow mentee Faraday) was brought aboard to serve. When their mentor was given command of his own starship, Valera was offered a transfer and promotion, which she declined in order to stay on the Nightingale. This disappointed Faraday who told her she wasn’t living up to her potential, their friendship has been strained ever since.Cocky and sometimes brash, Valera wields humor as a shield, deflecting her insecurities with a mix of bravado and wit. Her ship and crew, however, have become her anchors, grounding her restless nature in camaraderie. She is a damn good pilot, and truly loves her ship. She’s going to be the greatest pilot Starfleet has ever seen, whatever it takes.Valera is loyal to a fault, and will step in to defend her crew. She doesn’t mind getting into trouble if it’s for “her people.”She sometimes tests the limits of her ship in ways that border on dangerous. She craves the rush of pushing technology—and herself—to the limit. This high tolerance for risk sometimes verges on carelessness, especially in tense or dangerous situations.She deflects emotional or vulnerable moments with humor, making it hard for others to see her true feelings or insecurities. Her humor can distance her from forming deeper relationships.Valera respects competence over rank.For Valera, the Nightingale isn’t just an assignment—it’s her family, a place she feels understood and needed in ways few can match.Value1:: No Home but the Stars Value2:: Push the Limit, Find the Balance Value3:: I am the Helm Value4:: There’s Always a Way
Both Velara and Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Nightingale/Crew/Player Characters/Zephyr Grey grew up on the go and share a familiarity with being in space more-so than the ground.
Velara and Siltec Nol have a friendship forged in a common experience of being Starfleet ‘bad guys’ and occasionally getting shit for that.
Velara has gotten quite close with Jackson Hayes due to their shared experiences with Orion diplomacy. Jackson Hayes is a bit of a diplomatic brat and had seen his parents deal with Orions before. Their friendship began in Jefferies tubes.
Bas Sa'mi is uneasy with Velara on board, and suspects Velara might be using pheromones to get an advantage in her career.
Velara reports directly to Vrenta Ewasi, and they get along. Commander Ewasi, as a Bajoran, likes a people who aren’t afraid to stand up against Starfleet. Also Piracy is cool.

crew/player-characters/yalis.html.title: Yalis
crew/player-characters/yalis.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: she/her Location:: Unknown Type:: Main Character Status:: Commissioned NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Species:: Denobulan Role:: Science Officer Portrait:: Note:: Has a partially Klingon upbringing and loves discovering new species.
Yalis spent much of her childhood on Qo'noS, the Klingon homeworld, where her anthropologist mother studied Klingon culture.
The part of her family that lived on Qo'noS returned to Denobula for three months out of each year. Yalis was in frequent fights with Klingon children. This led to her interest in under-handed fighting tactics (size and strength don't matter if you poke someone in the eye) and also her determination to always stand up to bullies. As a child, she read a book where humans rode horses, and became determined to ride her pet targ. Her childhood fights and attempted targ-riding led to frequent trips to a Klingon doctor, who eventually performed a bone augmentation/strengthening procedure so she wouldn't keep breaking them.
She has the typical friendly and open demeanor of a Denobulan. Although she's still fairly new to the ship herself, Yalis will look out for new people and try to make them feel welcome. Yalis has great memory for social interactions. Tell her the name of your dog or kids and she'll remember and ask about them by name when you talk in the future. She does not follow the path of a Klingon warrior, but she does have a strong sense of honor when it comes to honesty and keeping her word. She wants a traditional Denobulan family with many wives and husbands, but her sense of romance is Klingon which has kept her from finding any spouses yet. She has the temper of a Klingon, but she keeps it under such tight wraps that usually only an empath would be able to tell when she's angry. But she survived her childhood by out-Klingoning the Klingon children, and if she perceives someone as a bully they might see a side of her that few people ever meet.
Yalis' favorite place on the ship is the Crop Sciences Lab. She enjoys being around all the plants. Yalis enjoys the "seek out new life" part of the Starfleet mission - she loves first contact, she loves learning about alien cultures and getting to know them, and she loves learning about their technology and biology. She is particularly interested in what digestive systems can tell us about the evolution, culture, and environment of a species, and is delighted if an opportunity arises to acquire a new fecal sample. On her first posting as an Ensign, her ship encountered the Scent-of-Blueberries-and-Ammonia, a non-humanoid species with an olfactory language. Using half-completed designs from her various projects, Yalis was able to create a biochemical/scent-based Universal Translator, leading to a successful first contact.
Yalis joined the crew of the USS Nightingale 6 months ago. She liked the idea of being directly involved in helping people while also being close to the frontier where contact with new species was likely. Value1:: I have a strong sense of honor when it comes to honesty and keeping my word. Value2:: When I see someone in distress, I try to help them. Value3:: Creative problem-solving can fix almost anything! Value4:: I will always stand up to a bully.
Yalis and Siltec share a love of horses. She finally got to ride them while she was training at Starfleet Academy on Earth, and was also fascinated that any species could manage to survive with such a ridiculous digestive system.
Serres - Yallis was previously reprimanded for tossing insults at them for
Relza, Daughter of Baylik and Yallisgraduated from Starfleet together and were roommates. They are frequent sparring partners.
Bas Sa'mi is a mentor to her as well as a bit of a father figure.
Yalis has taken Ensign Algan Kader (a new Betazoid science ensign) under her wing like a big sister
Yalis does not like Serres, the ship's Vulcan Chief Supply Officer, a petty little power-tripping bureaucrat. Following an incident where Serres restricted Ensign Kaden’s replicator access for "replicating too many writing devices" (3 in two weeks), Yalis lost her temper and called him "a massive turd obstructing the colon of scientific progress" as well as "a petaQ with a brain as smooth as his mother's forehead".
She narrowly avoided a reprimand for this incident, thanks to Bas Sa'mi intervening on her behalf with the Captain and First Officer

sessions/logs/adsog-log.html.title: Adsog Log
sessions/logs/adsog-log.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 11.2 - Abyss Station
Character:: Ujul Asaad Stardate:: 58191Log:: As a doctor you treat the comrade in front of you. Not the one you wish you had.This comrade was weird and annoying.I knew as part of the exchange I would need to come equipped with the “open mind” they called it.I am dedicated to my duty. I preserve honor and balance it with life and death. I do this for the patient and for The Empire. But opening this patient’s mind enough to comprehend life and honor was a chore.The patients “empire” has a death wish and the patient didn’t seem to understand if he was alive or dead despite all experience and medical evidence.I am perfectly willing to preserve a patients choice to find an honorable death or seek glory in life. Even if I do not understand their motivation or even believe they will achieve glory. Live and prove me wrong. Thank me later.But how am I supposed to respect your insane death cult if you dont? Convince me you want to die. Convince me you want to live. Choose or the choice is made for you. Meanwhile, despite my efforts to respect and fortify his convictions it seemed like Star Fleet was perfectly happy to talk him in circles until he came around to choosing life. The hypocrisy.I know my people value honor more than most. But I do not think others are without the concept. Still their willingness to risk a life without honor is troubling. If Akarra ever regrets his choice he will have to live his days with the belief that he ruined his people. What kind of life is that to save? Were they really so afraid of death, not even their own death, that they might inflict that fate upon another?The patient gave his support for the Captain’s decision to transport his entire people away from their believed ascension. To accept life. -But not for himself. He considers himself “already dead.” Currently. Maybe. I don't know. His mind is weak. I admit I am relieved at his choice though. Based on the Captain’s actions he would not have allowed Akkara to be transported to his world. Nor would he have listened if Akkara insisted we leave his people to their fate.It would be troublesome to question the Captains authority. I’m sure star fleet has a process for this that would take a million times longer to solve the issue than just killing him would. But even if this were an Empire ship I’m not sure I could have killed him fast enough to belay his order.Either way. The cultists are a fascinating species and culture. Their nanites while not borg are…unusual. I have obtained a sample to study. The officers do not seem concerned, and I am here to learn what they have. This could be quite interesting. Even if the application proves appalling, knowing and understanding it will be of use.As for the patient I have discharged him. He is physically sound and perhaps after bickering with his people his convictions will be as well. > In the meantime I will continue to respect his (philosophical?) belief he is dead. This time, when I hold the tea ceremony he is invited to join. It is not often one can speak to their dead patient. I hope he attends.

sessions/logs/meredith-skaarsen-log-5.2..title: Meredith Skaarsen Log 5.2
sessions/logs/meredith-skaarsen-log-5.2..description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 5.2 - Complexity
Character:: Captain Meredith Skaarsen, USS Walcott Stardate:: 56748Log:: The Walcott is on route to the Nightingale, where sensors indicate they are currently under fire from from a Cardassian Galor class cruiser.

sessions/logs/robin-zhao-log-1.1.html.title: Robin Zhao Log 1.1
sessions/logs/robin-zhao-log-1.1.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.1 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Robin Zhao Stardate:: 56241Log:: We've arrived at the Bacchus system after a power failure that nearly through the Nightingale into the system's star. The source of the failure seems to be a massive subspace disruption from ancient ruins on the planet.I have sent an away team to investigate the surface. Meanwhile a Klingon Bird of Prey fell out of warp with a power failure similar to what we experiences. We have caught the Klingon ship in our tractor beam until they are able to restore power to their systems.Both communications and warp travel seem difficulty or even impossible unless we can deactivate the source of the subspace distortion waves.

sessions/logs/robin-zhao-log-1.2.html.title: Robin Zhao Log 1.2
sessions/logs/robin-zhao-log-1.2.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.2 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Robin Zhao Stardate:: 56452Log:: We've made marginal progress towards escaping from Bacchus 3. The engineering team is still unable to bring us to warp through the subspace distortion waves.Several colonists have been recovered. Each of the colonists seem to have their organic material brought into resonance with the subspace waves. The more they resonate with the waves, the further they fall into subspace. Yalis has counteracted the resonance with a differential subspace signal to cancel out the noise on a local level.Several members of the Klingon starship Ya'Leth have also come aboard and are speaking with our medical and engineering teams. They have been unable to bring their warp core online. I've offered to send over an engineering team as soon as possible.For now, I'm awaiting a report from the surface team about.... hold on. Captain Zhao to the bridge: Is that a tractor beam coming out of that planet?Something like that sir. It appear to be pulling apart the nearby planet.Captain Zhao out.

sessions/logs/robin-zhao-log-5.1.html.title: Robin Zhao Log 5.1
sessions/logs/robin-zhao-log-5.1.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 5.1 - Simplicity
Character:: Robin Zhao Stardate:: 56748Log:: Admiral Banna Stoker has arrived to the Nightingale in a beat up shuttle with orders to investigate Pasqual-1. We are not to answer any hails or divert our course. The planet is surrounded by some kind of electromagnetic field that blocks any scanning of the service and prevent electrical equipment from functioning.Following Admiral Stoker's order's, I've sent an away team to the planet to learn anything they can. Meanwhile, the USS Walcott, a Nova Class scouting ship assigned has been sent to retrieve Stoker and bring her back for questioning. They say they are on orders from Starfleet command, but Stoker has insisted she is on a top secret mission.The Nightingale has been brought to red alert after beaming a companion of Stoker's on board from the Walcott. We have orders to disable the other Starfleet vessel if necessary to protect Stoker.

sessions/logs/velara-log-1.2.html.title: Velara Log 1.2
sessions/logs/velara-log-1.2.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.2 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Velara Stardate:: 56452Log:: Returned to ship with infected (?) colonists, worked with Bas (there's always a way! forced computer to successfully run config) to figure out what the "warp core" planet was doing (holy shit it turned the moons into monoliths!) monoliths are antennae! turning celestial bodies into warp nacels! Called the Klingon commander a targ, and helped out Lt. Grey's negotiation Went back to the planet and entered the monolith! It's active! I CAN FIX THIS

sessions/logs/velara-log-1.3.html.title: Velara Log 1.3
sessions/logs/velara-log-1.3.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.3 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Velara Stardate:: 56452Log:: While Grey and Lux worked to get lifeforms out of planet buffer, Siltec and I worked to Hack The Planet, gaining access to its warp core. Once the colonists were safely in the Nightingale's pattern buffer we cut the power to the planet, returning subspace functionality. I then (manually) flew through the oncoming meteor shower to assist the Klingon Bird of Prey. After Siltec ejected the warp core, I towed it to a safe distance so that the crew of the Nightingale could de-blue it.

sessions/logs/velara-log-2.html.title: Velara Log 2

Session:: Nightingale Log 2 A Klingon Christmas
Character:: Valera Stardate:: 56980.82Log:: Delivered all the gifts! Got to bring the nightingale into the atmosphere! Flew a shuttle to do a cool, extremely dangerous, stunt that almost killed me but thanks to the awesome help from my crewmates I had no lasting consequences and have no reason to not do it again!

sessions/logs/velera-log-3.1.html.title: Velera Log 3.1
sessions/logs/velera-log-3.1.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 3.1 - Orion Heist
Character:: Valera Stardate:: 57005Log:: My downtime studying the recent test flights Starfleet has been conducting was interrupted by an Orion ship fleeing the station after stealing an artifact that resembled the monoliths we encountered on Stardate -298065. We gave chase in one of the stations runabouts, the Mackenzie, as the Orions headed toward Romulan territory. We pushed the limits of the ship in order to catch them before they entered the Neutral Zone...We convinced the Orions that it was in their best interest to take our

sessions/logs/vrenta-log-11.html.title: Vrenta Log 11
sessions/logs/vrenta-log-11.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 10.1 - Rescue
Character:: Vrenta Stardate:: 57017Log:: First Officer’s log. Personal report on the rescue mission of Petty Officer Siltec Nol at the Science Conference on Dinasia. Petty Officer Nol had been missing in action since our encounter with the Romulan spy on the USS Hudson. Petty Officer Nol had grabbed the spy as he beamed off, disappearing along with the disguised Romulan. Four days ago, Starfleet Intelligence contacted the USS Nightingale to report that they suspected Petty Officer Nol was being held by the Romulans for his knowledge on a certain Cardassian scientist the Romulans had taken an interest in. Starfleet had arranged, or perhaps merely coopted, a scientific conference on Dinasia where the Romulans were expected to attempt to apprehend the Cardassian scientist. There, our mission was to find Petty Officer Nol or one of the Romulan intelligence agents who was aware of his location. Intelligence sent Commander Jones to assist in coordinating the mission, though as I noted in my formal report, her flagrant disregard of the chain of command and verbal disagreement with nearly every order was the opposite of helpful and significantly impacted our efficiency on this mission.Regardless. On site, several Starfleet officers including Lt. Yalis and Dr. Hernandez from the USS Hudson set up booths to display their scientific work and stay on the lookout for Petty Officer Nol. I kept close to the Cardassians and their booth, and though the Romulans came to view their shoddy work, they did not attempt to glean any significant intel. Misham Nol, Petty Officer Nol’s mother and a member the Obsidian Order, was also present. Fortunately, Ensign Kader was able to telepathically locate Petty Officer Nol, who had been surgically altered to appear as a Romulan attendee. Kader confirmed that Misham Nol was being used as leverage to force Petty Officer Nol to identify the Cardassian scientist. One security officer for the conference was shot, and soon after Ensign Kader foiled an assassination attempt on Misham Nol. Kader acted bravely and was injured in the attempt. I have written a formal recommendation for his promotion for bravery in the field. Security apprehended the assassins, though to avoid a diplomatic incident I told my officers to stand down and let the Romulans, the leaders of this alleged intelligence operation, beam out. Though, not before Lt. Yalis coated them with her science project, a large sample of feces containing a traceable radioactive isotope.Petty Officer Nol is recovering in sickbay after the EMH and Dr. Lux removed his surgical alterations. It is good that the young officer has been returned to the USS Nightingale. We have lost too many already even in the short time of our voyage. However, Petty Officer Nol has proven himself to be a rash and undisciplined officer. When he suspected Admiral Stoker of treachery, rather than confiding in any of his superior officers, he contacted a member of the Obsidian Order, who set a Cardassian mercenary team against the Nightingale. When he is recovered and back on duty, I will address this behavior with him and identify steps to correct it.

sessions/logs/yalis-log-1.1.html.title: Yalis Log 1.1
sessions/logs/yalis-log-1.1.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.1 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Yalis Stardate:: 56241Log:: The Nightingale was en route to Bacchus 3 when we were thrown out of warp by subspace waves.The grav plating went offline, and several people (including Chief Bas Sa'mi) were injured. When I arrived in Engineering, I performed first aid on Chief Sa'mi, and he was able to get the warp core back online. I found out from Velara afterwards that we were falling into a sun at the time, but fortunately she was able to get us into a stable orbit once the engines were back online.We continued to Bacchus 3, where we found that the source of the subspace waves was a 10 km tall monolith, part of the ancient ruins on the planet's surface. The monolith was covered in runes in an unknown language.We landed and spoke to the colonists, who had glowing blue patches under their skin and appeared to be entranced by the monolith. They said they were trying to figure it out. They had a subspace relay activated and pointed towards the monolith, but it was not what was causing the monolith to produce the waves. Velara found readings of a power source similar to a warp core in the planet's core.There were two Klingons on the surface, who had arrived ahead of their ship. Their Bird of Prey was knocked out of warp shortly after the away team arrived on the surface, and the Nightingale tractored the Klingon ship out of danger.Lt. Gray and Siltec attempted to convince the colonists to come to our ship with us, and eventually persuaded them to accept treatment for radiation exposure. Janus included a sedative in the treatment administered, making it easier to herd the colonists.One Vulcan colonist was attempting to decipher the runes and was particularly resistant to stopping his work and going with Siltec - I offered to continue his work for him. He pointed out two runes of particular interest likely to be related to other languages in this region of space. I am now attempting to decipher the runes.

sessions/logs/yalis-log-1.2.html.title: Yalis Log 1.2
sessions/logs/yalis-log-1.2.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.2 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Yalis Stardate:: 56452Log:: The colonists, Gray, and Velara went up to the Nightingale on the shuttle while Siltec, Janus and I stayed on the planet. I was able to interpret some of the runes on the monolith and discovered one of them identified a button for opening the monolith.A Klingon shuttle was approaching, but turned back when Janus and I informed them the planet was under quarantine. The colonists on the ship were also placed in quarantine by the EMH.While we were dealing with that, Siltec went to look for the rest of the colonists. He didn't find them, but he took his shoes off for some reason and contact with the planet made his feet get glowy/blue and start phasing into subspace. (We also found out that colonists who were blue had stopped showing up/disappeared, and were concerned this would happen to Siltec's feet.)I used the colonists' dish to transmit an inverse wave at Siltec's feet and restore them to normal space. When the team on the ship returned, I asked them to bring a metal tape measure, and built a yagi that can act as a portable de-bluer. I also informed the EMH and Chief Sa'mi of the solution I had discovered.The Klingon shuttle went to the Nightingale, where Gray and Velara talked to them. They did a very good job convincing the Klingons to cooperate with our handling of the situation, and earned the respect of the Klingons (when Commander Gluk was rude, Velara said she didn't know they let targs command ships). They didn't seem too concerned about D'Loq and Brutog (the two Klingon colonists in sickbay), they were just upset that their ship had been knocked out of warp.When Gray and Velara came back to the surface, we opened the monolith. Janus was under the influence of the monolith and tried to run inside, but Siltec stopped her and I de-blued her. Her medical tricorder was thrown in and hit by a defensive beam. Siltec knocked out the security sensors and we continued inside.When we got to the control room, the computer verbally greeted us and recognized us as a worthy species. It then began an activation sequence. Holograms depicted the monoliths drawing mass from nearby planets, which is probably what they're being activated to do.

sessions/logs/yalis-log-1.3.html.title: Yalis Log 1.3
sessions/logs/yalis-log-1.3.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.3 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Yalis Stardate:: 56452Log:: The computer and obelisks were built by the ancient Tikatal empire, and were pulling us into subspace because their mission was "to look for more of our kind" (this turned out to mean "humanoid").Valera hacked the planet (broke through their security systems) and with some creative engineering we were eventually able to beam out first an engineer from the colony named John, then all of the trapped people (including the ancient Tikatal, we didn't leave anyone behind).We also saved the Klingon ship the Yal'esh with some fancy flying from Valera and a de-bluer-enhanced explosion.

sessions/logs/yalis-log-2.html.title: Yalis Log 2
sessions/logs/yalis-log-2.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 2 A Klingon Christmas
Character:: Yalis Stardate:: 56980.82Log:: Kamin joined us for this session as Betazoid doctor Lt. Cmdr. Rennan Kader.We delivered presents (mostly weapons, also targs) to Klingon children on several colony planets along the border for the Klingon holiday of Tor'Gos.At the first planet we visited (Khitomer), we had to go down in a shuttle because the transporter couldn't reach some of the houses. Klingon children fired surface to air missiles at our shuttle, and we discovered it is customary for Klingon children to attack Klingon Santa (who was named Gar'Nash at first but later mutated to Gash'Nar). We retaliated by beaming balloons full of targ manure over their heads. (Balloons were produced by Rennan and Yalis wrestling a targ and giving it a laxative, then collecting the result.)At the second planet we visited (Beta Thoridor) there was subspace-related lightening in the atmosphere, and Valera was able to fly us under it. We completed that delivery pretty quickly. We also discovered there was a pathogen in the targ manure that made our skin emit a pheromone that smelled delicious to some predator animals, but fortunately Rennan was able to program the transporters to eliminate it (assisted by Bas Sa'mi).The third planet we visited (H'atoria) seemed uneventful until several Klingon children beamed aboard the ship and attacked Rennan in sickbay. He eventually got them to go out into the hallway by telepathically projecting the voice of Gash'Nar into their heads taunting them about looking in the wrong place. We then distracted them with a holographic Gash'Nar in the hallway, which kept them busy fighting until they could be beamed back to their homes.The fourth planet we visited (Gamma Eridon) was on the Klingon-Romulan border and had colonists of both species on the planet. Three Romulan ships were on the planet and tried to stop us from "delivering weapons to the planet". We attempted to explain to the Romulans that they were "childrens' weapons" and demonstrated the use of a targ poop balloon (Rennan threw it an Yalis), but the Romulans weren't convinced. We beamed targs onto the Romulan ships to keep them distracted while we made our deliveries, and then some clever flying by Valera (plus a targ chewing something near a Romulan warp core - thanks Kamin!) got us out of there without the Romulans being able to follow.The last planet we visited was Narendra, an important planet in the history of Klingon-Federation relations (this is where Captain Garret of the Enterprise-C made her heroic sacrifice to save Klingons from a Romulan sneak attack). Tor'Gos celebrations on this world typically involve a federation ship flying over the planet and detonating in the sky to commemorate the occasion. We decided that we would do something to the warp drive of a shuttle to make it able to sky-write Qapla' in glowing letters over the planet, then blow it up. Valera decided to fly the shuttle herself instead of having it on auto-pilot, but it didn't go well and she knocked the head off the statue of Captain Garret. Yalis was supposed to beam her out before the shuttle exploded, but our timing was off and Yalis beamed her out while the shuttle was exploding. Fortunately Rennan was able to heroically pull her back from the brink of death and she survived.Throughout the mission, Valera pushed the engines to their limits and got us places quickly. We made all of our deliveries.

sessions/logs/yalis-log-3.1.html.title: Yalis Log 3.1
sessions/logs/yalis-log-3.1.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 3.1 - Orion Heist
Character:: Yalis Stardate:: 57005Log:: The Nightingale went to Starbase 364 (Narendra station, a base jointly run with the Klingons, primarily a research station), to unload the ancient Tikatal from our pattern buffer.Siltec, Relza, and Yalis sparred in the holodeck. Yalis swung around on the stalactites and shined light in Siltec's eyes to blind him. Siltec threw Relza at her. Siltec thought he had won, but since his phaser was pointed at Relza (who was on Yalis), Yalis grabbed Siltec's ankle to pull him to the ground, then took his hat hostage to win the sparring.Vrenta Awasi and Admiral Stoker met us at the doors to the holodeck with a mission, and gave us a data PADD with information about an artifact recently stolen from the station. The block looked like sandstone, was a few feet in size was gem-shaped like a mini-monolith, and had runes on it like we had encountered at Baccus 3. The artifact was found on the nearby planet Dinassia 2. It was scanned before the theft - no energy emissions, but it had certain alloys under the surface (they couldn't scan much deeper). It was stolen 2 days ago, after the Nightingale had deactivated the Baccus 3 monolith.We checked out the archive it was stolen from - someone had entered without using the door, and we found a transporter signature consistent with Orien transporters. There was only one Orien ship in the area recently, the SS Castlerock, a freighter/merchant ship under the command of Captain Peljara. We told Admiral Stoker what we found, then took the runabout the McKenzie to go after them.We caught up with the McKenzie near the edge of the Romulan neutral zone. Subspace waves were present, and Yalis applied the debluer modifications to the runabout's deflector to create subspace shielding.Velara told them they had forgotten to pay the "neutral zone identification fee" (implying an Orien bribe), and they agreed to let us onboard. Before we came onboard, the back end of the Casterock appeared to be crushed like a can, there was a containment breach, and things started to float out but were then pulled back in.

sessions/logs/yalis-log-3.2.html.title: Yalis Log 3.2
sessions/logs/yalis-log-3.2.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 3.2 - Orion Heist
Character:: Yalis Stardate:: 57019Log:: Stolen artifact may be some kind of controller for monolithsWe were on the runabout MacKenzie, chasing the Orien ship SS CastlerockAway team went to Castlerock, Artax stayed with shuttle. Captain Paljara was captain of the Orion ship.Meezone the Orion engineer was messed up by attempting to cybernetically connect to the artifact, brought back with us.Situation eventually resolved when we gave Oriens counterfeit artifact to give the Romulans and helped them make their ship look like it had been in combat.Back at Narendra station, Admiral Bana Stoker debriefed us.

sessions/logs/yalis-log-4.html.title: Yalis Log 4
sessions/logs/yalis-log-4.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 4 - Peas to Meet You
Character:: Yalis Stardate:: 57030Log:: Time jump, we are now orbiting Ray Alpha 5, a successful colony due to excellent flora/farming - great superfoods on this planet, really healthy. Self-sustaining, now able to export crops, also trying to introduce some of their plant species on other colonies.1-week trip from Ray Alpha to Yacci system, taking exports and passengers.Yalis taught the kids a Klingon game which she modified so that instead of sneaking up and hitting each-other on the back of the head with sticks they sneak up and leave thumb prints on the backs of each-others' heads in water-soluble easily-washable paint. By night she analyzes stool samples to see how the superfoods are affecting the gut microbiome.Radix Bina (she) is a joined trill, lead crop scientist from the planet. There are some bushes called "ice peas"Janis had an allergic reaction to the ice peas, a kid Yalis was chasing had a reaction, Yalis took kid to sick bay, doctor identified ice peas were over-producing a particular protein that triggered the reaction. (I'm naming the kid Brom.) Gray also had an allergic reaction and went to sickbay.Velara (who also ate a berry) didn't have an allergic reaction but noticed how nice Janus' spots were. Janus put the crop lab on lockdown when she first had a reaction.Much horniness ensued, with people who hadn't eaten berries becoming wildly attracted to adults who had (or developing strong protective/parenting instincts towards kids who had).Yalis' girlfriend Relza went off with Gray (who had eaten a berry), but he avoided sleeping with her and just led her back to sickbay.Janus and Velara were very, very into each-other in sickbay. Siltec and the Vulcan went off together. Yalis became extremely protective of the kids, and alternated between trying to find a cure and encouraging the children to observe the fascinating display of mating behaviors.It turned out that when separated from their native soil the ice peas made a protein that caused all of this. The captain was eating a bowl of the peas and watching a movie. We eventually released an aerosolized cure in the ship's ventilation systems. Janus and Velara had a difficult time with this because they didn't want to stop feeling what they felt for each-other, but eventually managed to put the ship and crew first.

sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-1.1.html.title: Zephyr Grey Log 1.1
sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-1.1.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.1 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Nightingale/Crew/Player Characters/Zephyr Grey Stardate:: 56241Log:: The USS Nightingale lost power due to a subspace gravitational wave while in transit to Bacchus-3. I took over communications and organized medical teams. I sent Lt. Relza and Lt. Yalis to engineering, where they treated MCPO Bas Sa'mi. Together, the engineering team was able to restore power, and Lt. Velara pulled us out of the gravitational well of the Bacchus-3 star system.We entered stable orbit and beamed down, where we encountered seven colonists who appeared entranced and sickened by the Monolith emitting the subspace waves. The team was able to treat and sedate the colonists in preparation for taking them to the USS Nightingale.

sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-1.2.html.title: Zephyr Grey Log 1.2
sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-1.2.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.2 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Nightingale/Crew/Player Characters/Zephyr Grey Stardate:: 56452Log:: The Klingons, led by Commander Gluk, were acting angry and scared as they lacked the information they needed to assess the situation. By speaking openly and fairly with the Klingons and accepting and offering assistance, I defused the tensions between our ships and gained an ally.

sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-1.3.html.title: Zephyr Grey Log 1.3
sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-1.3.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 1.3 - Bacchus-3
Character:: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Nightingale/Crew/Player Characters/Zephyr Grey Stardate:: 56452Log:: Though untried and untested, we forged ourselves into a capable team as we worked together to uncover this planet's long-lost secrets and save who could. Turns out, that was many more people than anticipated. Lt. Lux located the colony's Chief of Engineering in the computer's pattern buffer, but we realized it would take far too long to transport the colonists out one at a time. With the technical brilliance of Lt. Yalis, I boosted the signal and not only transported the colonists to the USS Nightingale, where they were treated in the medical bay, but also sent over the digitized lives of over 1000 of the planet's original inhabitants. At Captain Zhao's orders, we did not revive them on board. This was logical due to the space constraints on the USS Nightingale, not to mention the potential dangers they could pose as beings with much greater technological prowess than ourselves. However, I am grateful that we were able to save them, no matter what future problems this may cause. Every life is worth saving. They deserve a chance at a new future.

sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-2.2.html.title: Zephyr Grey Log 2.2
sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-2.2.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 3.2 - Orion Heist
Character:: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Nightingale/Crew/Player Characters/Zephyr Grey Stardate:: 57019Log:: We tracked down the Orion ship, the SS Castle Rock, at the border of the neutral zone. The Castle Rock was damaged after one of their engineers, Mizzone, interfaced with the artifact. PO Siltec was able to transport the artifact to our runabout while Dr. Lux tended to the addled Mizzone. Lt Velara used her hidden phaser to knock out the captain, Paljara. Though violence had quickly ignitied, I seized the opportunity to defuse the situation and talked the remaining security officers down. Together, we negotiated for the Orions to take a counterfeit artifact that Lt. Yalis had replicated to the Romulans and keep our involvement quiet. We all got out with only a few bumps and headaches for PO Siltec and Captain Paljara. Though, Captain Paljara did slip me her comms link. Perhaps she hopes to continue mutually beneficial diplomatic negotiations in the future?

sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-4.html.title: Zephyr Grey Log 4
sessions/logs/zephyr-grey-log-4.html.description:
Session:: Nightingale Log 4 - Peas to Meet You
Character:: Zephyr Grey Stardate:: 57030Log:: Our mission was to transport a number of colonists and agricultural products from Ray Alpha 5 to another Federation Colony in the Yachi system. During this voyage, many of the crew members and colonists unknowingly ingested the fruit of a plant, colloquially known as an "ice pea" that made them amorously irresistible to those around them. Though Lt. Relza set her eyes on me, I was able to distract her by reciting Klingon poetry and leading her back to the medical bay, strapping her in while Lt. Yalis and Dr. Lux worked on a cure. I admit I was...overcome at the last. I suppose I should not be too harsh on myself, considering none by the Holographic Doctor seemed mostly immune to the effects. Yet, I find myself wishing to put this entire experience behind me and think on it no further.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale  Log 0
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Note:: The crew of the USS Nightingale is recruited and prepared for duty (and friendship!) Character Relationships

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description:
Stardate:: 56241
Note:: The Nightingale arrived at Bacchus 3, where they discovered some colonists trying to activate some ancient alien ruins. The planet itself had a warp core signature at its center.
Thing

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 1.2 - Bacchus-3
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description:
Stardate:: 56452 Mission:: Bacchus' Irresistible Call Note:: The colonists of Bacchus-3 were found to have their organic material resonating with the subspace distortion waves and their mass phased into subspace. The Klingons joined the Nightingale while the away team has entered the monolith, only to trigger it’s systems. Thing
Previous Session: Nightingale Log 1.1 - Bacchus-3 Next Session:

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 1.3 - Bacchus-3
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description:
New One Shot! Mr. Winters, a major weapons manufacturer in Spire, is hosting a New Year's party. The Ministry would like to send a message to it's enemies. Kill Mr. Winters at his party. Don't make it look like an accident. December 30: https://startplaying.games/adventure/cm4a60m9p0036ocq65etgvz3g
December 31: https://startplaying.games/adventure/cm4a634wn004x10v9m9go31np As always, these one shots are free for players in my ongoing campaigns! Stardate:: 56452
Mission:: Bacchus' Irresistible Call Note:: The Nightingale successfully evacuated the remaining colonists from Bacchus-3 and recovered an active buffer of other lifeforms, including what we believe are the remaining missing colonists. In the process, we deactivated the alien device causing the subspace distortion waves and rescued a Klingon ship from a warp core containment breach. The Nightingale is towing the Klingon ship back to Narendra station for repairs and to receive our next assignment.
Previous Session: Nightingale Log 1.2 - Bacchus-3 Next Session:

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 2 A Klingon Christmas
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description:
Thing Stardate:: 56980.82 Mission:: Christmas Deliveries
Note:: The Nightingale was assigned on a diplomatic mission to deliver toys of violence to children on the Klingon-Federation border. The crew was assaulted by the children, but creatively managed to deliver the gifts with minimal harm to crew or the children. The final stop involved creating a fireworks show by blowing up a shuttle. In this incident, Lieutenant Velara nearly died but was beamed off the exploding shuffle at the last moment and saved by the medical staff.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 3.1 - Orion Heist
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description:
Stardate:: 57005 Mission:: The Orion Heist
Note:: A few members of the Nightingale were recruited by Admiral Banna Stoker to find and retrieve a stolen artifact similar to the monument found on Bacchus-III. The away team took a shuttle, the USS Mackenzie, to chase after the SS Castle Rock, an Orion merchant freighter. There the Castle Rock suffered a breach when the back end crumpled from subspace distortion waves.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 3.2 - Orion Heist
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Thing Stardate:: 57019 Mission:: The Orion Heist Note:: The Crew of the USS Mackenzie boarded the Orion Castle Rock to retrieve the stolen artifact. One of the Orions was cybernetically connected with the artifact using a neural net and seemingly hypnotized by it. After a brief combat encounter, the artifact was retrieved. The Orions agreed to take a well made counterfeit copy of the artifact to sell to the Romulans.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 4 - Peas to Meet You
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Thing Stardate:: 57030 Mission:: Peas to Meet You Note:: The crew assisted the colony of Re Alpha to transport it's bountiful produce to the struggling colony at the Yacci system. However, a popular treat called Ice Peas had an unexpected reaction to being transplanted. The crew all experienced enhanced attraction to one another until the medical and science teams were able to develop a cure.
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Nightingale/Sessions/Summaries/Season 1/Nightingale Log 4 - Peas to Meet You.md

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 5.1 - Simplicity
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 56748 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: Admiral Banna Stoker boarded the Nightingale and took command of the ship. After arriving at Pasqual-I, an away team was beamed down to investigate the electromagnetic field surrounding the planet's surface. Meanwhile, another Federation vessel arrived to retrieve the admiral, by orders from Starfleet.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 5.2 - Complexity
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 56748 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: The Nightingale's away team investigated the Tilikaal obelisk on Pasqual-1 and discovered that it was forcing an accelerated evolution for life on the planet. It was attempting to make contact with the Tilikaal but had been abandoned for thousands of years. The away team deactivated the obelisk but then were beamed off the planet by the USS Walcott. The Walcott had confronted the Nightingale to demand custody of Admiral Stoker. However, the Nightingale fled into warp speed rather than fight the Walcott.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 5.3 - Clarity
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Thing Stardate:: 56748 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: The Nightingale defended itself against a Cardassian battlecruiser, apparently with a bounty on Admiral Stoker. After the battlecruiser was defeated, Captain robin Zhao received a transmission from the USS Walcott informing them that Admiral Stoker was likely compromised by Tilikaal influence. Stoker was arrested. Her companion, Kassandra Pruitt and the alien entity possessing her, was interviewed aboard the Nightingale. Ultimately, the entity was expelled from Pruitt using a subspace anti-resonance.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 7 - Ghostbusters
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Thing Stardate:: 56748 Mission:: Ghostbusters Note:: The Tilikaal entity was released from Kassandra Pruitt, and quickly fled into the rest of the USS Nightingale. The crews of the Nightingale and Walcott cooperated to find it. However, the entity was able to possess various other officers to get control of the Tilikaal Artifact. Along with several other Tilikaal entities, apparently gaining access to real space through the artifact, it attempted to pull the entire ship into subspace, but was thwarted by a heroic sacrifice by Lt. Grey.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 8 - Border Dispute
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Thing Stardate:: 56906 Mission:: Border Dispute Note:: The Nightingale was summoned to rescue the USS Hudson, a Nova class science ship that had unexpectedly veered into Romulan space. A Romulan Warbird fired upon and disabled the Hudson. A rescue team was sent to the Hudson to investigate and provide help. There. they discovered a Romulan spy posing as a Vulcan. As the warbird wrestled wit the Hudson using a tractor beam, both sides began beaming crew off the ship. Siltec attempted to stop the spy from escaping on the Nightingale, unaware that the Romulans were beaming the spy off. Siltec has not been seen since.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 9 - Order in Court
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 56942 Mission:: Shackleton Expanse/Missions/Season 1/Order in Court Note:: While the crew of the USS Nightingale was on shore leave, Admiral Stoker stood trial, with Captain Zhao, Ensign Kader, and Lt. Relza among the witnesses. Prosecutor Loxor argued Stoker endangered Starfleet, while her lawyer Tokmoth questioned whether Stoker truly intended harm. It was found that Stoker's behavior could have been caused by ideas incepted into Stoker's mind. Ensign Kader telepathically heard the judge's planning to convict Stoker unfairly in order to cover up Starfleet Intelligence secrets. After exposing this with help from Tokmoth and Yalis, the judge was arrested and a mistrial declared. Stoker resigned her commission shortly after the trial.Aram played Loxor the Ferengi prosecutor (non-Starfleet, most of Starfleet didn't want to touch the trial) and a guest star played Captain Ojok Tokmoth the Klingon defense lawyer Additional details learned during session: Stoker was a Rear Admiral The other Admiral in charge of Narendra Station was Admiral Opok Krakt (she/her), it's a joint Federation/Klingon operation After stealing artifact, Stoker was on another ship exploring planets, encountered trouble, fled to Nightinggale while being chased by USS Walcott The artifact was stored in a special Starfleet box for safety until incident with Orions, only recently been out to be studied. The judge was Admiral Jackson Nolan (human, he/him).Before trial, Stoker was talking to Tokmoth in a secure area/meeting room for privacy. Explains attourney/client privilege, Stoker doubts them, Tokmoth invokes Klingon honor, Stoker says not like she has a choice anyway. Tokmoth says Stoker has right to challenge them to a duel if defense not good.Opening arguments: Loxor opening argument was centered on General Orders 17 and 29 about not unnecessarily endangering Starfleet personnel or the Federation. Tokmoth opening argument is that it's our duty to explore but that we don't control what we find (invoked Prime Directive as an example) and that it's important fill in gaps with assumptions. Tokmoth says duty is to explore single question - did admiral stoker display both intent and ability to carry out crimes accused of.Review of facts, then lunch. Loxor interviewed Lt. Relza, who was against Stoker and saw no medical evidence for influence. Tokmoth talked further with Admiral Stoker, found out she considered herself a whistle-blower and that the Federation were exploiting the Tilikaal for their technology.Captain Zhao took the stand, asked questions by both sides. Loxor tried to build a case that the Tilikaal are an existential threat to the Federation. Tokmoth tried to build a case that it was Starfleet's duty to interact diplomatically with a species asking for help and that hostility and motivations can be difficult to interpret in unfamiliar cultures.Tokmoth spoke to Lt. Yalis, Yalis explained that Admiral doesn't have an ancient Tilikaal in her but does Yalis said Admiral used to be more cautious and that behavior changed after contact with artifact. Yalis also thinks Lt. Gray might have been mind-controlled into his stunt with the transporters and the ghosts.An initial interaction between Tokmoth and Algan Kader happened, can't remember if it was on the stand or asking questions. (Forgot to take notes during this part, HELP does anyone have details?)Out of courtroom, Yalis investigated artifact. Found it was broadcasting a wide/untargeted subspace signal that was probably a distress call. Also used a medical testing hologram to discover that it could have subtle effects on the brain that might affect thoughts/behavior. Yalis told Tokmoth about this. Got permission to use scanner on Admiral Stoker, Admiral Stoker's brain showed effects.Admiral Stoker took the stand, questioned by both Loxor first. If free and given a ship, she would go to a facility the Tilikaal told her about. Tried to establish a case that Stoker was serving the Tilikaal. Then Tokmoth asked questions - Admiral does not believe what she wants to do would endanger the Federation.During Admiral Stoker's questions with Tokmoth, Algan Kader noticed thoughts in the room. Admiral Krakt was angry the court martial was questioning her friend Admiral Stoker's honor. Admiral Nolan (the judge) was thinking lyrics to "Twinkle twinkle little star" to block mind-reading, on closer look Kader heard him think "I have to convict her and remove her from the picture" (referring to Admiral Stoker).Ensign Kader told Yalis he needed a disturbance so he could talk to Tokmoth. Yalis started some dyke drama with Relza and it escalated into punching, arrested, session went to recess. Kader told Tokmoth about what he heard in the judge's thoughts.When court reconvened, Tokmoth called Kader to the stand, and had him reveal what he had heard in the judge's thoughts. Admiral Krakt had Klingon security on the station arrest the judge, and a mistrial was declared.After the trial, Admiral Stoker resigned her commission, is now a civilian. Loxor and Tokmoth talked after court, acknowledged each-other as worthy adversaries, might even work together in the future. Tokmoth also talked to Ensign Kader and commended his bravery in coming forward and said helping cowards find their bravery to create a more honorable galaxy is why they became a lawyer.If Yalis is charged for the punch-up in the courtroom, Tokmoth will defend her.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 10.1 - Rescue
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 57017 Mission:: Convention Note:: Starfleet Intelligence sources believed Siltec to be in custody of the Romulans as they attempted to learn more about the Cardassian Disruptor Spinal Lance technology. To lure his captors out, they organized a science and technology convention in the name of peace and cooperation across the Alpha and Beta quadrants. The crew of the Nightingale was brought in to display their findings from research in the Shackleton Expanse.During the convention, Siltec was disguised as a Romulan and told to identify Cardassian engineers who worked on the Spinal Lance. Though reluctant to comply, Siltec's mother, Misham Nol, was conspicuously present at the convention. Siltec's handler, Sub-Commander Thal'vaek threatened to kill her if he did not cooperate.Ensign Algan quickly identified Siltec telepathically, and notified the crew and Starfleet Intelligence. But when a Starfleet officer was killed near Misham as a warning, the innovation floor exploded into chaos. Misham was beamed out of the convention by Starfleet, just as several other Romulan agents fired on her.

sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 10.2 - Home Safe
sessions/summaries/season-1/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 57026 Mission:: Convention Note:: After the evacuation of Misham Nol, the Romulan agents responsible were quickly stunned and arrested. The Romulan delegation themselves meanwhile set up pattern enhancers and beamed out of the convention center.Misham Nol was unhappy with Starfleet handling of Siltec's situation, and blamed both Robin Zhao and Ewasi personally for the danger Siltec was in. And when she finally met Siltec at Sickbay, she attempted to convince him to leave Starfleet. She even threatened to get the Nightingale grounded and all it's crew reassigned. Siltec disarmed her with loving understanding. Starfleet needs him and it's where he belongs.Back at Narendra Station, Starfleet held a formal social event. After dinner, Algan Kader was promoting to Lieutenant JG. The promotions were given out by new leadership aboard Narendra Station: Admiral April Hebert. At this event, a small memorial was available as a final farewell to Lt. Zephyr Grey, which was visited by his parents.Robin wish Yalis and Relza farewell also, as they would be getting married and transferring to a space station.

sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 11.1 - Looking into the Abyss
sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 57056 Mission:: Abyss Station Note:: The Nightingale pursued Romulans to Omega Draconis, where a black whole seemed to suddenly threaten life on an orbiting planet and also systems up to 100 light years away. The people living on the orbiting planet awaited their ascension, believing they were in no danger. Meanwhile, an away team entered a Tilikaal space station to find the Romulans in the control room.The Nightingale was sent on a mission to the Omega Draconis system to find out what the Romulans were doing there. There, a single planet and a Neutronium space station orbiting a black hole. The black hole itself began rotating, so that it's radiation jets were aligned with the galactic plane. This threatened to utterly destroy the planet, but also throw radiation up to 100 light years away.On the planet, a landing party found a small colony of less than 1000 people called the Ithik worshiping the black hole. They seemed excited to finally have the Abyss gaze back at them, after they had observed it for thousands of years. The landing party made some attempts to explain that the black hole would obliterate them, but the Ithik remained convinced they would ascend to a high form of existence when the truth of the universe is revealed to them through the black hole.The Ithik had with them a single artifact from the Tilikaal, similar to the artifact that Banna Stoker used. Commander Vrenta used the artifact to recieve a vision of the Neutronium space station. The landing party then took the artifact, beamed onto a shuttle, and went straight to the space station with only 2 hours until Chaktir would be destroyed.Siltec used the artifact as a key to enter the station. Inside, they found a small Romulan scout ship in a docking bay. Siltec was able to pick up trace heat signatures left over from when the Romulans passed by. The away team split up into two teams. Siltec and Vrenta found large security robots lined with Neutronium plugged into stations along the walls. Holly Jones and Ujul Atsad found a cloning facility and released a person who claimed to be Akkara, the "mayor" of Chaktir. They were confused about how they got there but remembered being visited by Tilikaal on Chaktir.Vrenta and Siltec were able to finally locate the station's control room, and sent directions to Cmdr. Jones and Lt. Asad. But the Romulans were already inside.
sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Nightingale/Sessions/Summaries/Season 2/Nightingale Log 11.1 - Looking into the Abyss.md

sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 11.2 - Abyss Station
sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 58191 Mission:: Abyss Station Note:: The away team on Abyss Station defeated the Romulans in the control room. Rala disabled the security systems, and Siltec helped sway the Romulans to defect. The crew began efforts to realign the black hole and destroy the station. Holly Jones disappeared during the mission, raising concerns.Inside the control station orbiting Chaktir, Lt. Rala and Siltec approached the commander center's door Rala pretended to be sent by Romulus to offer aid. The Romulan officer Thal’vaek was in the room and Siltec recognized his voice, but stayed out of sight.Siltec opened fire when a Romulan grabbed Rala’s arm. A firefight broke out where Lt. Cmdr. Jones fired to kill and dropped one target. In the chaos, Rala accessed the station’s engineering systems and disabled the facility’s automatons. After Commander Jones stunned Thal’vaek. The rest surrendered.Vrenta wanted to try diplomacy with the Romulans, but Thal’vaek was stubborn. Rala used her telepathy to read Thal'vaek's mind and found he had been contacted by a Tal Shiar agent and ordered to recover any technology found.Siltec delivered a heartfelt speech appealing to the Romulans' loyalty to their families persuaded them to defect. Senior officer T’Vel agreed first and the others followed. Thal’vaek called them traitors.With the Romulans’ help, the team began to reorient the black hole’s jets and prepare to destroy the station before it could fall into the wrong hands. Rala and Vrenta worked at the main control consoles. Holly Jones and a Romulan went missing while allegedly seeking the engine room.Siltec continued reasoning with Thal’vaek, revealing details about his own family’s sacrifice. Thal’vaek resisted, telling Siltec that his mom was a traitor to her people. Vrenta finally ordered Siltec to stop stalling and check on Holly.

sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 11.3 - Displacement
sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.description: Stardate:: 59240 Mission:: Abyss Station Note:: Atsad confirmed Akkara was 4,000 years out of time and infected with Tilikaal nanites. The team stabilized the black hole and sabotaged the station's singularity engines, trigginging a collapse of the entire solar system. The Ithik were beamed off their planet without full consent.With Jones still absent, Dr. Atsad focused on questioning the duplicate Akkara, who had been recovered from stasis. Atsad learned that 4,000 years had passed since Akkara’s abduction. The duplicate exhibited signs of nanite infection. He was distressed about being suddenly away from his home.Meanwhile, Rala and Vrenta stabilized the black hole’s spin. Rala confessed to stealing a component from the automaton controls to prevent misuse. Vrenta approved of the decision.Siltec and a Romulan engineer named Merdeck located the station’s power core. Siltec persuaded Merdeck to sabotage the engines and help destroy the station.To evacuate safely, Atsad and Vrenta claimed the Romulans were contaminated with nanites and needed to report to the shuttle bay. Most complied but Thal’vaek refused. Vrenta stunned him and dragged him aboard.Rala joined Siltec and Merdeck in overloading the engines. Siltec collapsed during the escape but was pulled to safety by Merdeck. The away team successfully evacuated as the station detonated.Akkara hesitated to evacuate his people. But Vrenta recommended forced evacuation. Atsad, Rala, and Siltec intervened with more empathy. Rala gifted Akkara a windchime made from latinum. Siltec gave him his hat.The Ithik were transported off their planet without warning. A monument from their observatory in the form of a telescope was also beamed aboard.Merdeck and Thal’vaek were placed in the brig.

sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 12 - Finding Faith
sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.description:
Stardate:: 59279
Note:: Tensions with the evacuated Ithik escalated as Mayor Akkara accused Starfleet of violating their faith. Akkara's clone, avoided contact with his people, but was eventually persuaded to reach out to them, causing division amongst them. The crew eased tension by constructing a religious space for them aboard the ship, and started planning an asteroid relocation to construct a new home.The USS Nightingale departed Chaktir carrying the evacuated Ithik and the clone known as “Ourkkara,” who had been in stasis for thousands of years. Tensions rose when Mayor Akkara accused Starfleet of kidnapping his people and Ourkkara avoided speaking with them.Vrenta and Rala tried to calm the Ithik, but Mayor Akkara resisted, viewing Starfleet’s actions as a violation of their faith. Meanwhile, Rala discovered that Ministers Vodlin and Naklep could no longer hear the harmonic pitch they once associated with the black hole, gifting them a tuning fork to aid in regaining the sound.The crew met with Captain Zhao and decided to build an Ithik religious space aboard the ship, including a nanite-filled sensory deprivation pool and sound-isolated walls. Rala proposed a feasibility study for towing an asteroid into orbit around the black hole to provide the Ithik a new home, successfully simulating its viability.Holly revealed a distorted recording of Lt. Grey, thought lost near Ithik space, but was confined to quarters after clashing with Zhao over her unauthorized use of lethal force.Conflict escalated when Mayor Akkara accused Ourkkara of being a spy and attempted to stab him. Akkara's helmet broke and it revealed he was identical to Ourkkara in every way.Rala used her asteroid simulation and the possibility of aid from the Wandering Kindred of the Song to win over key ministers, easing tensions in the cargo bay. By the session’s end, the Ithik accepted the newly built religious room aboard the Nightingale, giving the crew a path toward reconciliation and future cooperation.

sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.title: Nightingale Log 13.1 Crystal Clear
sessions/summaries/season-2/nightingale-.description:
Stardate:: 59317
Note:: The Nightingale investigated a mysterious crystalline vessel near Narendra Station, discovering hundreds of non-organic sentiences within and a lodged titanium torpedo. Attempts to communicate failed as the ship began discharging energy, and Siltec and Rala pushed through heavy fire to secure the torpedo. When it was transported out, it exploded, leaving both officers critically injured and breaching the vessel’s hull.The USS Nightingale returned to Narendra Station, where the crew prepared for a new mission. While onboarding new officers, Vrenta learned that Terzin Lux carried Janus’ symbiont and realized Janus had died. Preparations were interrupted when sensors detected an unidentified object approaching the station at warp speed. Its unusual readings suggested neither conventional propulsion nor cloaking, prompting General Kargan to call for its destruction. Vrenta refused, earning Kargon’s respect by instead arranging a blockade and leading the Nightingale to investigate.Upon approach, the object revealed itself as a massive crystalline vessel. Rala sensed faint telepathic activity, but communication failed, and scans showed hundreds of non-organic sentiences within its structure. Zephyr Industries claimed salvage rights and attempted to dissipate the vessel’s warp bubble, but the Nightingale convinced them to wait while the crew beamed aboard to investigate. Inside, they detected a titanium torpedo lodged within the crystalline walls and encountered a labyrinthine interior filled with both vacuum pockets and liquid-filled chambers.The crystals suddenly discharged energy against nearby ships, striking the Nightingale and Zephyr vessels. Terzin attempted to interact with the walls but was injured, while his phaser fire was mirrored back by the crystalline structures, suggesting the energy discharges might be a form of communication rather than hostility. As the away team navigated deeper, Siltec and Rala rushed toward the torpedo under heavy fire. Siltec managed to tag the device for transport, but when the Nightingale beamed it away, it detonated. The explosion left Siltec and Rala unconscious with critical injuries and blew a hole in the crystalline hull.

uss-nightingale.html.title: USS Nightingale
uss-nightingale.html.description:
Summary Location:: The Shackleton Expanse Year:: 2381
Portrait:: The NCC-60805-C: A colony support and emergency response ship.
A Federation Intrepid Class starship commanded by Captain Robin Zhao. It has a mission profile for colony support and is a first responder ship for emergencies. Federation Ship Intrepid Class Hope Ship The USS Nightingale is the 3rd ship of its name. The original Nightingale was a small medical supply ship in the 2280s. In the in the 2370s, the NCC-60805-B was a Nebula Class hospital ship commanded by Captain Nandi Jadeja. The 60805-B was sent behind enemy lines during the Cardassian insurgency, where it collected escape pods and other survivors. The current NCC-60805-C Nightingale was commissioned in 2373 and has been serving as a colony support vessel for nearly 10 years The Nightingale is outfitted for colony support and provides cargo transfers, medical backup, and miliary presence to new colony worlds. These colonies are the kind of places that deal with the unknowns which still appear even after years of survey and study, so the Nightingale is equipped to response flexibly to a wide variety of needs.Season 1
Nightingale Log 0: Stardate -The crew of the USS Nightingale is recruited and prepared for duty (and friendship!)

The Nightingale is towing the Klingon ship back to Narendra station for repairs and to receive our next assignment.
