At this event, a small memorial was available as a final farewell to Lt. Zephyr Grey, which was visited by his parents.Robin wish Yalis and Relza farewell also, as they would be getting married and transferring to a space station.
Nightingale Log 2 A Klingon Christmas: Stardate 56980.82
The Nightingale was assigned on a diplomatic mission to deliver toys of violence to children on the Klingon-Federation border. The crew was assaulted by the children, but creatively managed to deliver the gifts with minimal harm to crew or the children. The final stop involved creating a fireworks show by blowing up a shuttle. In this incident, Lieutenant Velara nearly died but was beamed off the exploding shuffle at the last moment and saved by the medical staff.
Nightingale Log 3.1 - Orion Heist: Stardate 57005
A few members of the Nightingale were recruited by Admiral Banna Stoker to find and retrieve a stolen artifact similar to the monument found on Bacchus-III. The away team took a shuttle, the USS Mackenzie, to chase after the SS Castle Rock, an Orion merchant freighter. There the Castle Rock suffered a breach when the back end crumpled from subspace distortion waves.
Nightingale Log 3.2 - Orion Heist: Stardate 57019The Crew of the USS Mackenzie boarded the Orion Castle Rock to retrieve the stolen artifact. One of the Orions was cybernetically connected with the artifact using a neural net and seemingly hypnotized by it. After a brief combat encounter, the artifact was retrieved. The Orions agreed to take a well made counterfeit copy of the artifact to sell to the Romulans.
Nightingale Log 4 - Peas to Meet You: Stardate 57030The crew assisted the colony of Re Alpha to transport it's bountiful produce to the struggling colony at the Yacci system. However, a popular treat called Ice Peas had an unexpected reaction to being transplanted. The crew all experienced enhanced attraction to one another until the medical and science teams were able to develop a cure.
Nightingale Log 5.1 - Simplicity: Stardate 56748Admiral Banna Stoker boarded the Nightingale and took command of the ship. After arriving at Pasqual-I, an away team was beamed down to investigate the electromagnetic field surrounding the planet's surface. Meanwhile, another Federation vessel arrived to retrieve the admiral, by orders from Starfleet.
Nightingale Log 5.2 - Complexity: Stardate 56748The Nightingale's away team investigated the Tilikaal obelisk on Pasqual-1 and discovered that it was forcing an accelerated evolution for life on the planet. It was attempting to make contact with the Tilikaal but had been abandoned for thousands of years. The away team deactivated the obelisk but then were beamed off the planet by the USS Walcott. The Walcott had confronted the Nightingale to demand custody of Admiral Stoker. However, the Nightingale fled into warp speed rather than fight the Walcott.
Nightingale Log 5.3 - Clarity: Stardate 56748The Nightingale defended itself against a Cardassian battlecruiser, apparently with a bounty on Admiral Stoker. After the battlecruiser was defeated, Captain robin Zhao received a transmission from the USS Walcott informing them that Admiral Stoker was likely compromised by Tilikaal influence. Stoker was arrested. Her companion, Kassandra Pruitt and the alien entity possessing her, was interviewed aboard the Nightingale. Ultimately, the entity was expelled from Pruitt using a subspace anti-resonance.
Nightingale Log 7 - Ghostbusters: Stardate 56748The Tilikaal entity was released from Kassandra Pruitt, and quickly fled into the rest of the USS Nightingale. The crews of the Nightingale and Walcott cooperated to find it. However, the entity was able to possess various other officers to get control of the Tilikaal Artifact. Along with several other Tilikaal entities, apparently gaining access to real space through the artifact, it attempted to pull the entire ship into subspace, but was thwarted by a heroic sacrifice by Lt. Grey.
Nightingale Log 8 - Border Dispute: Stardate 56906The Nightingale was summoned to rescue the USS Hudson, a Nova class science ship that had unexpectedly veered into Romulan space. A Romulan Warbird fired upon and disabled the Hudson. A rescue team was sent to the Hudson to investigate and provide help. There. they discovered a Romulan spy posing as a Vulcan. As the warbird wrestled wit the Hudson using a tractor beam, both sides began beaming crew off the ship. Siltec attempted to stop the spy from escaping on the Nightingale, unaware that the Romulans were beaming the spy off. Siltec has not been seen since.
Nightingale Log 9 - Order in Court: Stardate 56942While the crew of the USS Nightingale was on shore leave, Admiral Stoker stood trial, with Captain Zhao, Ensign Kader, and Lt. Relza among the witnesses. Prosecutor Loxor argued Stoker endangered Starfleet, while her lawyer Tokmoth questioned whether Stoker truly intended harm. It was found that Stoker's behavior could have been caused by ideas incepted into Stoker's mind. Ensign Kader telepathically heard the judge's planning to convict Stoker unfairly in order to cover up Starfleet Intelligence secrets. After exposing this with help from Tokmoth and Yalis, the judge was arrested and a mistrial declared. Stoker resigned her commission shortly after the trial. Season 2
Nightingale Log 11.1 - Looking into the Abyss: Stardate 57056The Nightingale pursued Romulans to Omega Draconis, where a black whole seemed to suddenly threaten life on an orbiting planet and also systems up to 100 light years away. The people living on the orbiting planet awaited their ascension, believing they were in no danger. Meanwhile, an away team entered a Tilikaal space station to find the Romulans in the control room.The Nightingale was sent on a mission to the Omega Draconis system to find out what the Romulans were doing there. There, a single planet and a Neutronium space station orbiting a black hole. The black hole itself began rotating, so that it's radiation jets were aligned with the galactic plane. This threatened to utterly destroy the planet, but also throw radiation up to 100 light years away.On the planet, a landing party found a small colony of less than 1000 people called the Ithik worshiping the black hole. They seemed excited to finally have the Abyss gaze back at them, after they had observed it for thousands of years. The landing party made some attempts to explain that the black hole would obliterate them, but the Ithik remained convinced they would ascend to a high form of existence when the truth of the universe is revealed to them through the black hole.The Ithik had with them a single artifact from the Tilikaal, similar to the artifact that Banna Stoker used. Commander Vrenta used the artifact to recieve a vision of the Neutronium space station. The landing party then took the artifact, beamed onto a shuttle, and went straight to the space station with only 2 hours until Chaktir would be destroyed.Siltec used the artifact as a key to enter the station. Inside, they found a small Romulan scout ship in a docking bay. Siltec was able to pick up trace heat signatures left over from when the Romulans passed by. The away team split up into two teams. Siltec and Vrenta found large security robots lined with Neutronium plugged into stations along the walls. Holly Jones and Ujul Atsad found a cloning facility and released a person who claimed to be Akkara, the "mayor" of Chaktir. They were confused about how they got there but remembered being visited by Tilikaal on Chaktir.Vrenta and Siltec were able to finally locate the station's control room, and sent directions to Cmdr. Jones and Lt. Asad. But the Romulans were already inside.
Nightingale Log 11.2 - Abyss Station: Stardate 58191The away team on Abyss Station defeated the Romulans in the control room. Rala disabled the security systems, and Siltec helped sway the Romulans to defect. The crew began efforts to realign the black hole and destroy the station. Holly Jones disappeared during the mission, raising concerns.Inside the control station orbiting Chaktir, Lt. Rala and Siltec approached the commander center's door Rala pretended to be sent by Romulus to offer aid. The Romulan officer Thal’vaek was in the room and Siltec recognized his voice, but stayed out of sight.Siltec opened fire when a Romulan grabbed Rala’s arm. A firefight broke out where Lt. Cmdr. Jones fired to kill and dropped one target. In the chaos, Rala accessed the station’s engineering systems and disabled the facility’s automatons. After Commander Jones stunned Thal’vaek. The rest surrendered.Vrenta wanted to try diplomacy with the Romulans, but Thal’vaek was stubborn. Rala used her telepathy to read Thal'vaek's mind and found he had been contacted by a Tal Shiar agent and ordered to recover any technology found.Siltec delivered a heartfelt speech appealing to the Romulans' loyalty to their families persuaded them to defect. Senior officer T’Vel agreed first and the others followed. Thal’vaek called them traitors.With the Romulans’ help, the team began to reorient the black hole’s jets and prepare to destroy the station before it could fall into the wrong hands. Rala and Vrenta worked at the main control consoles. Holly Jones and a Romulan went missing while allegedly seeking the engine room.Siltec continued reasoning with Thal’vaek, revealing details about his own family’s sacrifice. Thal’vaek resisted, telling Siltec that his mom was a traitor to her people. Vrenta finally ordered Siltec to stop stalling and check on Holly.
Nightingale Log 11.3 - Displacement: *Stardate 59240*Atsad confirmed Akkara was 4,000 years out of time and infected with Tilikaal nanites. The team stabilized the black hole and sabotaged the station's singularity engines, trigginging a collapse of the entire solar system. The Ithik were beamed off their planet without full consent.With Jones still absent, Dr. Atsad focused on questioning the duplicate Akkara, who had been recovered from stasis. Atsad learned that 4,000 years had passed since Akkara’s abduction. The duplicate exhibited signs of nanite infection. He was distressed about being suddenly away from his home.Meanwhile, Rala and Vrenta stabilized the black hole’s spin. Rala confessed to stealing a component from the automaton controls to prevent misuse. Vrenta approved of the decision.Siltec and a Romulan engineer named Merdeck located the station’s power core. Siltec persuaded Merdeck to sabotage the engines and help destroy the station.To evacuate safely, Atsad and Vrenta claimed the Romulans were contaminated with nanites and needed to report to the shuttle bay. Most complied but Thal’vaek refused. Vrenta stunned him and dragged him aboard.Rala joined Siltec and Merdeck in overloading the engines. Siltec collapsed during the escape but was pulled to safety by Merdeck. The away team successfully evacuated as the station detonated.Akkara hesitated to evacuate his people. But Vrenta recommended forced evacuation. Atsad, Rala, and Siltec intervened with more empathy. Rala gifted Akkara a windchime made from latinum. Siltec gave him his hat.The Ithik were transported off their planet without warning. A monument from their observatory in the form of a telescope was also beamed aboard.Merdeck and Thal’vaek were placed in the brig.
Nightingale Log 12 - Finding Faith: Stardate 59279Tensions with the evacuated Ithik escalated as Mayor Akkara accused Starfleet of violating their faith. Akkara's clone, avoided contact with his people, but was eventually persuaded to reach out to them, causing division amongst them. The crew eased tension by constructing a religious space for them aboard the ship, and started planning an asteroid relocation to construct a new home.The USS Nightingale departed Chaktir carrying the evacuated Ithik and the clone known as “Ourkkara,” who had been in stasis for thousands of years. Tensions rose when Mayor Akkara accused Starfleet of kidnapping his people and Ourkkara avoided speaking with them.Vrenta and Rala tried to calm the Ithik, but Mayor Akkara resisted, viewing Starfleet’s actions as a violation of their faith. Meanwhile, Rala discovered that Ministers Vodlin and Naklep could no longer hear the harmonic pitch they once associated with the black hole, gifting them a tuning fork to aid in regaining the sound.The crew met with Captain Zhao and decided to build an Ithik religious space aboard the ship, including a nanite-filled sensory deprivation pool and sound-isolated walls. Rala proposed a feasibility study for towing an asteroid into orbit around the black hole to provide the Ithik a new home, successfully simulating its viability.Holly revealed a distorted recording of Lt. Grey, thought lost near Ithik space, but was confined to quarters after clashing with Zhao over her unauthorized use of lethal force.Conflict escalated when Mayor Akkara accused Ourkkara of being a spy and attempted to stab him. Akkara's helmet broke and it revealed he was identical to Ourkkara in every way.Rala used her asteroid simulation and the possibility of aid from the Wandering Kindred of the Song to win over key ministers, easing tensions in the cargo bay. By the session’s end, the Ithik accepted the newly built religious room aboard the Nightingale, giving the crew a path toward reconciliation and future cooperation.
Nightingale Log 13.1 Crystal Clear: Stardate 59317The Nightingale investigated a mysterious crystalline vessel near Narendra Station, discovering hundreds of non-organic sentiences within and a lodged titanium torpedo. Attempts to communicate failed as the ship began discharging energy, and Siltec and Rala pushed through heavy fire to secure the torpedo. When it was transported out, it exploded, leaving both officers critically injured and breaching the vessel’s hull.The USS Nightingale returned to Narendra Station, where the crew prepared for a new mission. While onboarding new officers, Vrenta learned that Terzin Lux carried Janus’ symbiont and realized Janus had died. Preparations were interrupted when sensors detected an unidentified object approaching the station at warp speed. Its unusual readings suggested neither conventional propulsion nor cloaking, prompting General Kargan to call for its destruction. Vrenta refused, earning Kargon’s respect by instead arranging a blockade and leading the Nightingale to investigate.Upon approach, the object revealed itself as a massive crystalline vessel. Rala sensed faint telepathic activity, but communication failed, and scans showed hundreds of non-organic sentiences within its structure. Zephyr Industries claimed salvage rights and attempted to dissipate the vessel’s warp bubble, but the Nightingale convinced them to wait while the crew beamed aboard to investigate. Inside, they detected a titanium torpedo lodged within the crystalline walls and encountered a labyrinthine interior filled with both vacuum pockets and liquid-filled chambers.The crystals suddenly discharged energy against nearby ships, striking the Nightingale and Zephyr vessels. Terzin attempted to interact with the walls but was injured, while his phaser fire was mirrored back by the crystalline structures, suggesting the energy discharges might be a form of communication rather than hostility. As the away team navigated deeper, Siltec and Rala rushed toward the torpedo under heavy fire. Siltec managed to tag the device for transport, but when the Nightingale beamed it away, it detonated. The explosion left Siltec and Rala unconscious with critical injuries and blew a hole in the crystalline hull.

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar
